newsitem.title: UK: IPE Brent hits session high but seen vulnerable.
newsitem.headline: IPE Brent hits session high but seen vulnerable.

text.p: IPE Brent crude futures hit a session high in mid-afternoon trade, tracking a strong opening on NYMEX crude futures, but brokers said the market looked set to shed gains.
June Brent was trading 13 cents up at $18.29 a barrel at 1422 GMT, having touched a high of $18.32 moments earlier.
"At the moment it seems to be tracking NYMEX but I feel that we'll be seeing lower numbers before the end of the session," said one dealer.
Brokers said a breach of $20.00 by June NYMEX crude lent strong technical momentum to the market on both sides of the Atlantic, as Wednesday's highs were swept aside.
"(NYMEX crude) jumped over $20.00 and gained a bit of technical ground and London was happy to follow," said one.
But some dealers said that a general bearish undertone in the market meant that the market was vulnerable to falls.
"Any rallies are seen as good selling opportunities," said one.
